snippet: Addressing members of the Human Rights Campaign on Saturday, Hillary Rodham Clinton and Joseph R. Biden emphasized rights for transgender people, saying they should be allowed to serve in the military.
abstract: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton and her potential rival Vice Pres Joe Biden, in dueling speeches, promise sweeping support of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender Americans to gathering of members of influential gay rights group Human Rights Campaign; both enjoy generally fervent support from crucial constituency.
lead_paragraph: Addressing members of the Human Rights Campaign on Saturday, Hillary Rodham Clinton and Joseph R. Biden emphasized rights for transgender people, saying they should be allowed to serve in the military.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton and Joe Biden, in Dueling Speeches, Focus on Transgender Rights
headline.print_headline: Clinton and Biden, in Dueling Speeches, Focus on Transgender Rights
